item.title: Uber bike chaos, 16th September
item.description:
The bike bay has posts missing for its allotted area allowing over use, it was chaos yesterday afternoon as can be seen from the picture. My car was damaged due to bikes pilling up in the residence bay illegally. What action are you going to take against uber to resolve this unacceptable situation?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): England's Lane, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead wood falling from tree, 16th September
item.description:

item.title: Dumping of waste on private property by neighbor, 16th September
item.description:
Our neighbor decided to fix their broken fence and clean up their area. In the process he moved all of the waste in their area into my our area where our kids play. This is a private rented property. The mattress looks dangerous for the health of my kids as that is the only area where they can have their playtime. This is the second time he's doing that. I decided to make a report because I don't want any confrontation with him. Please investigate as quickly as possible as this items may be hazardous to our children's health. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Campfield Road, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light outside no 15,16,17, 16th September
item.description:
We had new light fitted a few weeks ago - the light between houses 15-18 is not working. The lady who lives in 15 is nearly blind - this would help her - please fix it

item.title: Smell coming from Pittagoras, 16th September
item.description:
Hello We live above a Greek fast food place called 'Pittagoras', the smell of fried food is very strong, unable to have windows open in summer and smell permeates inside, garden also smells. I've tried contacting them directly but no resolve. Thanks.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sidworth Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 16th September
item.description:
It's obvious what's wrong with this. The black bags were dumped on the pavement about two weeks ago; the parking bay has been like that for 6 months. It's a real pleasure having to walk past this every day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Sandy Hill Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sandy Lane Trees and bushes, 16th September
item.description:
Please can the council consider removing the big tree at the end of the bull pub garden on Sandy Lane while the road is closed for electricity cable work. It is a dangerous pinch point in the road. Also along the whole golf course hedges between the gym and golf course cause narrow lanes and also make the footpath dangerous and dark especially for people using it. Could everything be removed to open it all up?? It’s the ideal time to do it now. Thanks?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Lane, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned land, 16th September
item.description:
The owner of the abandoned land needs to make the land access secure to stop fly tipping. This land has been like this for many months nearly a year now. The site is become overgrown and attracting fly tipping and vermin. This also now an eyesore to the area and the council needs to do something about this and contract the owner of the land to enforce action is taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lesney Park, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged kerb, 16th September
item.description:
My dropped kerb needs adjustment as often needs me to drop off of the kerb onto a metal drain causing tyre damage when leaving my property! Probably moving angled kerbstone a foot or so Please advise
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 210, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
